headline: UnitedHealth Group Replaces CFO John Rex
summary: UnitedHealth Group  said it would replace its chief financial officer as it seeks to execute a turnaround, hiring a longtime healthcare executive who once held the same position at one of its rivals.  Wayne DeVeydt,  55, will take over as UnitedHealth CFO on Sept. 2, the company said, replacing  John Rex,  who had served in the job since 2016.  Rex, 63, will become a strategic adviser to UnitedHealth CEO  Stephen Hemsley  at that time.

raw.headline: UnitedHealth Group Replaces CFO John Rex
raw.summary: UnitedHealth Group  said it would replace its chief financial officer as it seeks to execute a turnaround, hiring a longtime healthcare executive who once held the same position at one of its rivals.  Wayne DeVeydt,  55, will take over as UnitedHealth CFO on Sept. 2, the company said, replacing  John Rex,  who had served in the job since 2016.  Rex, 63, will become a strategic adviser to UnitedHealth CEO  Stephen Hemsley  at that time.

headline: UnitedHealth replaces CFO Rex in another management shake-up
summary: Rex, who has been the company's CFO since 2016, will continue as a strategic adviser to the CEO, with the changes effective September 2.  DeVeydt, 55, was most recently managing director and operating partner at Bain Capital, and was also the finance chief of UnitedHealth's rival Elevance, then called Anthem, between 2007 and 2016.  DeVeydt will get an annual base salary of $1 million and other benefits such as equity awards and a $2 million life insurance policy, UnitedHealth said.

DeVeydt will get an annual base salary of $1 million and other benefits such as equity awards and a $2 million life insurance policy, UnitedHealth said.

headline: CVS hikes adjusted earnings guidance as Aetna performance improves
summary: The company raised its outlook as many insurers are struggling with elevated medical costs in the second quarter.

raw.headline: CVS hikes adjusted earnings guidance as Aetna performance improves
raw.summary: The company raised its outlook as many insurers are struggling with elevated medical costs in the second quarter.

headline: CVS raises profit forecast as cost controls drive profit beat
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -CVS Health raised its annual profit forecast after beating quarterly estimates on Thursday, as tight oversight of higher medical costs led to improved performance for its Aetna health insurance business.  "Nothing is a surprise to us this quarter," said CEO David Joyner in an interview with Reuters.  Joyner, who was named CEO in October, said the Aetna business experienced higher costs in its Medicare Advantage plans sold through groups such as employers or retiree organizations, but those costs were accurately anticipated.
